result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher S Tice

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
9:25 AM Defendant Christopher S Tice in court, in custody.  Attorney Tsz-King Tse in court for Christopher S Tice.  Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin. Testimony of Detective Cline. State rests. No witnesses by Defense. Arguments. Court makes findings, finds probable cause, and binds matter over for trial. State files the information. Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bond motion heard. Arguments. Court makes findings and denies motion.
Further proceedings scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on November 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

8:40 AM Defendant Christopher S Tice appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Tsz-King Tse in court for Christopher S Tice.  Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requests date for preliminary hearing. State to advise if date is a conflict for witnesses.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.

2:03 PM Defendant Christopher S Tice appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Tsz-King Tse in court for Christopher S Tice.  Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel continues to waive time limits for preliminary hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status hearing on September 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:01 PM Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher S Tice appeared by video from the Ozaukee County jail, in custody. Defendant advises qualifies for PD and is awaiting appointment of counsel. Court continues to find good cause to extend time limits. Defendant request modification of bail. Arguments. Court makes findings and denies request.
Status hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status hearing on August 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Absolute sobriety. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. No contact with any females under the age of 18. Not to possess any dangerous weapons. Not to leave the State of Wisconsin. Surrender passport to Ozaukee County Sheriff's Department or Grafton PD. No contact with JO. No contact with: Victims listed in complaint. Defendant to avoid the victim's residence and/or any location temporarily occupied by the victim. The defendant avoid contacting the victim or causing any person other than a party's attorney or law enforcement officer to contact the victim. Contact includes: contact at victim's home, work, school, public places, in person, by phone, in writing, by electronic communication or device, or in any other manner.

1:21 PM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher S Tice appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Christopher S Tice as a friend of a court. Defendant will retain private counsel. Counsel waives reading. Court advises of charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State recommends $50,000 cash bail w/conditions. Counsel recommends $10,000 cash bail. Court finds good cause to extend time limits.
Status hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
